column4: so the suggestion was to uncomment all other sources and "reload everythign"
most of it was cause by the kubuntu update process
the easiest solution would be to reinstall the whole ubuntu
but even this is not so easy for me at the moment
I am not sure what I should leave on and what not
I was told to use system -> package management etc but I don't know hwo to do that
btw.. about reinstalling everything.. do you have a separate /home partition?
then what do you have to back up?
which is already on a separate partition. So just leave that untouched, backup the few other things, and reinstall
the encryption key is in your ubuntu keychain, save that somewhere before reinstalling
did you find your encryption key in the keychain manager?
Applications > Accessories > Passwords and Encryption keys
remember my kde desktop is non responsive
I use lxde and yet I have it
